Second, whether each of them has exactly three films that were entered for an Academy Award.

Let me start by listing out all the directors and counting how many times each appears in the "director(s)" column.

Looking through the table:

1992: Krsto Papić
1993: Zvonimir Berković

2004: Antun Vrdoljak
2005: Arsen Anton Ostojić
2006: Veljko Bulajić
2007: Ognjen Sviličić
2008: Arsen Anton Ostojić (again)
2009: Antonio Nuić
2010: Goran Dević & Zvonimir Jurić (so two directors here, each gets a count)
2011: Danilo Sherbedžija
2012: Branko Schmidt (third time)
2013: Arsen Anton Ostojić (third time)

Now let's tally up the counts:

- Branko Schmidt appears in 1994, 2001, and 2012. That's three films.
- Arsen Anton Ostojić appears in 2005, 2008, and 2013. Also three films.
- Zrinko Ogresta: 1995 and 1999 – two films.
- Vinko Brešan: 2000 and 2003 – two films.
- Others have only one film each.

So both Branko Schmidt and Arsen Anton Ostojić have three entries each, which is the highest count in the table. So they are tied as the most prolific directors with three films each.

Now checking if each has three Academy Award-entered films. The "result" column shows whether the film was nominated or not. For Branko Schmidt:

- 1994: Vukovar... result is not nominated.
- 2001: Queen of the night... not nominated.
- 2012: Cannibal Vegetarian... not nominated.

So all three films were not nominated, but they were entered. The claim doesn't specify if they were actually nominated; it just says Academy Award-entered films. So if "entered" means submitted for consideration, then yes, each has three films entered.

Arsen Anton Ostojić:

- 2005: A Wonderful Night in Split... not nominated.
- 2008: No One's Son... not nominated.
- 2013: Halima's Path... result is TBD. But since the table shows "tbd," it's possible that this film was entered but its nomination status isn't decided yet.

So Ostojić has three films entered as well.

Therefore, both directors have three films each entered into the Academy Awards. So the claim seems to hold: they are the most prolific with three entries each.
</think>
